thread.section_title: John Terry one of four Chelsea players fuming with Antonio Conte – Metro
thread.title: John Terry one of four Chelsea players fuming with Antonio Conte
thread.title_full: John Terry one of four Chelsea players fuming with Antonio Conte

author: Coral Barry
title: John Terry one of four Chelsea players fuming with Antonio Conte
text:
John Terry has barely played this season (Picture: Getty) John Terry and several other first-team Chelsea players are fuming with Antonio Conte after the manager left them on the bench for the FA Cup quarter-final.
Mbappe & the four Monaco stars Chelsea, Man Utd and Arsenal should be fighting to sign Conte had been using the FA Cup to give his fringe players a run out, but with Manchester United pitching up to Stamford Bridge on Monday, the Italian decided to field his strongest eleven.
This meant Terry and his centre-back partner Kurt Zouma warmed the bench while Asmir Begovic was pushed out of the eleven by No.1 stopper Thibaut Courtois.
Chelsea youngster Nathan Ake did not even make the matchday squad, leaving several players angry with Conte’s snub, according to the Sun. 
Chelsea fixtures Stoke (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Manchester United (A) – Sun 16 Apr
Southampton (H) – Sun 23 Apr
Everton (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Kurt Zouma is another Chelsea player finding game time hard to come by (Picture: Getty) The team selection paid off with Chelsea beating ten-men United 1-0 in the game.
There was no complaints from any of their other first-team players, but Terry and co are reportedly unhappy with the lack of faith shown by Conte.
Nathan Ake has played just twice since returning from loan (Picture: Getty) More: Football Romelu Lukaku's preferred destination revealed with Chelsea and Man United's interested 
Jose Mourinho reveals his biggest ever fail in the dressing room 
Guardiola sets two unwanted Champions League records as Man City crash out to Monaco 
Terry and Zouma have played most of their minutes this season in the cup competitions, but were ousted for the high-profile game.
Ake returned to Stamford Bridge from Bournemouth under the impression he would be given first-team action, but the defender has played just 180 minutes since arriving back in January.
MORE: Romelu Lukaku reportedly prefers Chelsea return this summer
